field.label: URL Exceptions
field.comment:
This is the difference between a simplified and advanced regex:
Regex (simplified) let's you use * and | to specify dynamics URL's. For example, */catalog/product|category/view/* would let a none logged in client access all product and category pages on your website, even if you later decide to change your base url since the initial * will match anything. The pipe (|) character means or, so in this example that means product or category.

Regex (advanced) is used when you wish to write the regex entirely on your own, so if you are tech savvy and have the need for something very specific you can utilise this to get your exceptions exactly right.
field.tooltip: Simplified regex:es will work for most situations. * = anything, | = or. Example: */catalog/category|product/*
